bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Albert G. Love, August 12, 1952

div1.p: Hench asks Love to check into the [Cuban] situation, since Siler is ill.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Albert G. Love, August 12, 1952
div1.opener:
August 12, 1952
General Albert E. Love
2709 Wisconsin Avenue N.W.
Washington, D. C.
My dear General Love:
div1.p:
Permit me to send you a copy of a letter I have just sent to General
Reed.

Colonel Siler is ill, I wonder if you could or would be willing to
get together with General Reed on this matter and perhaps visit the
Surgeon General or one of his associates informally to see that they
are aware of the situation and to see what they plan to do. Please
see the enclosed copy of the letter I have sent to the Surgeon General.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
